result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Rashard Jordan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin(>3-10g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)2.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin(>3-10g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)2.
  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>3-10g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  FAiure to pay wil result in a civil judgment:  restitution in the amount of $1,440.00 payable to Milwaukee Metro Drug Enforcement Group; all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA; all applicable fees of supervision.
Cash bail on deposit to be applied to restitution in this case first, then to restitution in case#s 15CF4183 and 15CF5068.  Second priority all costs, fees, surcharges in this case and cases#'s 15CF4183, 15CF5068 and 15CF2979.  Any bail remaining to be forefeited as a fine.
All court costs, surcharges and restitution to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with all other counts, but consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for 131 days.

superMiscConds.notes: No alcohol or drugs.  No possession, consumption, selling, distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
Follow all rules of supervision. Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment. Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; also advised that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other counts, but consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for 131 days.

IT IS ORDERED that the petition for a writ of habeas corpus is denied.  No costs to either party.

records.addlTxt: per order dated June 19, 2017, Appeal Nos. 2017AP1063-W (15CF2297), 2017AP1064-W (15CF2979) 2017AP1065-W (15CF4183) and 2017AP1066-W (15CF5068), IT IS ORDERED that by July 19, 2017, Jordan shall submit an appropriately verified petition.  Failure to submit an appropriately verified petition will result in dismissal.

per order dated June 15, 2017, Appeal No. 2017AP001063W, IT IS ORDERED that the court grants permission to proceed without payment of the filing fee.  This order waives only the filing fees in the Court of Appeals.  It is not a determination of indigency for any other purpose.  Indigency may be reevaluated if a request is received for waiver of other fees based on indigency.
Acknowledgement of Filing a Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus with the Wisconsin Court of Appeal. Appeal No. 2017AP001063 W
To/From Defendant
PLEA HEARING Transcript commencing JANUARY 27, 2016 received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 15CF5068 (26 Pages). kl
SENTENCING HEARING Transcript commencing MARCH 11, 2016, received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 15CF5068 (67 Pages).  jm
Restitution

Defendant Steven Rashard Jordan in court with attorney Rebecca M Coffee.  Defendant Steven Rashard Jordan in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  7 YEARS with 131 days credit CONCURRENT to all other Counts but CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS 6 MONTHS.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  7 YEARS with 131 days credit CONCURRENT to all other Counts but CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS 6 MONTHS.

As to Count 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  7 YEARS with 131 days credit CONCURRENT to all other Counts but CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS 6 MONTHS.

As to Count 4:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  7 YEARS with 131 days credit CONCURRENT to all other Counts but CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS 6 MONTHS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $1,440 payable to Milwaukee Metro Drug Enforcement Group; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied to restitution in this case first, then to restitution in case#s 15CF4183 & 15CF5068.  Second priority- all costs, fee, surcharges in this case and case#s 15CF4183, 15CF5068 and 15CF2979.  Any bail remaining to be forfeited as a fine.
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Letters in Support of the Defendant received and filed.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Steven Rashard Jordan in court with attorney Rebecca M Coffee.  Defendant Steven Rashard Jordan in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
As to Counts 1-4:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.
At the request of the Defense, and without objection from the Court or the State the January 27, 2016 date is converted from a scheduling to a plea hearing in Branch 22 at 8:30am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  Defendant discharged due to in custody status.

Scheduling conference scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.
